conclusion: To determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second, analyze the given x-t (position-time) graph.
The graph shows a linear relationship between position x and time t.
The car is moving with a constant velocity.
The slope of the x-t graph represents the velocity of the car.
The line passes through the points (-2, 0) and (0, 10).
Calculate the change in position (Δx) from -2 to 0 as 2 meters.
Calculate the change in time (Δt) from -2 to 0 as 2 seconds.
Since the slope is positive and constant, the car is moving at a constant velocity of 1 m/s.
The speed of the car remains constant throughout the time interval shown on the graph.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 1 m/s.
